meanings.definition: Competing with someone else for the same objective or for superiority in the same field of activity.
meanings.sent1: The two rivalrous teams battled fiercely for the championship title.
meanings.sent2: In a rivalrous game of chess, each player strategizes to outsmart the other.
meanings.sent3: The rivalrous squirrels raced up the tree to gather the most acorns.
meanings.sent4: Their rivalrous spirit burned like a bright flame in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The rivalrous atmosphere in the classroom was palpable as students vied for the top spot.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or inclined to rivalry.
meanings.sent1: Her rivalrous nature emerged when she challenged her friend to a race.
meanings.sent2: The rivalrous siblings constantly competed for their parents' attention.
meanings.sent3: The rivalrous cats playfully pounced on each other in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The rivalrous relationship between the two companies led to intense marketing battles.
meanings.sent5: His rivalrous attitude made him strive for excellence in everything he did.
